Code documentation

zerobug.z0testlib

class zerobug.z0testlib.Z0test(argv=None, id=None, version=None, autorun=False)

The command line program to execute all tests in professional way.

assertEqual(first, second, msg=None, msg_info=None)
assertFalse(expr, msg=None, msg_info=None)
assertGreater(first, second, msg=None, msg_info=None)
assertGreaterEqual(first, second, msg=None, msg_info=None)
assertIn(first, second, msg=None, msg_info=None)
assertLess(first, second, msg=None, msg_info=None)
assertLessEqual(first, second, msg=None, msg_info=None)
assertMatch(first, second, msg=None, msg_info=None)
assertNotEqual(first, second, msg=None, msg_info=None)
assertNotIn(first, second, msg=None, msg_info=None)
assertNotMatch(first, second, msg=None, msg_info=None)
assertTrue(expr, msg=None, msg_info=None)
build_os_tree(*args)

Create a filesytem tree to test

default_conf(ctx)
doctest(ctx, testname)

testname format is ‘__doctest_FILE’ where: FILE: pathfile to execute doctest (macro expanded)

exec_local_test(T, testname, ctx=None)
inherit_cls(test_cls)
main(ctx={}, Cls2Test=None, unittest_list=None)

Default main program for test execution

Args:

ctx (dict): context Cls2Test (class): test class for internal tests unittest_list (list): Unit Test list (if None, search for files)

main_local(ctx, Cls2Test, unittest_list=None)

Default main program for local tests

msg_test(ctx, msg)
new_Cls2Test(Cls2Test)
parseoptest(arguments, version=None, tlog=None)
remove_os_tree(*args)

Remove a filesytem tree created to test

ret_sts()
set_shabang(ctx, testfile)
set_test_env(ctx)
set_tlog_file(ctx)
test_failed(msg, first, second=None)
test_result(ctx, msg, test_value, result_val, op=None)
test_version(ctx, testname)

testname format is ‘__version_T_VVVVFILE’ where: T: type - May be:

‘V’ = exec ‘testfile -V’ ‘v’ = exec ‘testfile -v’ ‘P’ = exec ‘testfile –version’ ‘1’ = use VVVV ‘0’ = use internal value __version__

VVVV: version - Version to match (must be {0-9.}+) FILE: pathfile to execute to match version (macro expanded)

version()
class zerobug.z0testlib.Z0testOdoo(argv=None)
build_odoo_env(*args, **kwargs)

Build a simplified Odoo directory tree version: 18.0, 17.0, 16.0, 15.0, 14.0, 13.0, …, 7.0, 6.1 name: name of odoo dir (default equal to version) hierarchy: flat,tree,server (def=flat)

Old version had the following signature: build_odoo_env(self, ctx, version) Now param ctx is deprecated, so we have to analyze parameters

create_module(*args, **kwargs)

Build a simplified Odoo module version: 18.0, 17.0, 16.0, 15.0, 14.0, 13.0, …, 7.0, 6.1

Old version had the following signature:
create_module(self, ctx, repo_root, name, version,

moduletype=None, dependencies=None)

Now param ctx is deprecated, so we have to analyze parameters

create_repo(*args, **kwargs)

Build a simplified Odoo repository version: 18.0, 17.0, 16.0, 15.0, 14.0, 13.0, …, 7.0, 6.1

Old version had the following signature:

create_repo(self, ctx, root, reponame, version, name=None, repotype=None)

Now param ctx is deprecated, so we have to analyze parameters

get_local_odoo_path(git_org, reponame, branch, home=None)
get_outer_dir()

Get dir out of current virtual environment In local tests it serves to find local Odoo repositories to avoid git clone or wget from web.

git_clone(remote, reponame, branch, odoo_path, force=None)
real_git_clone(remote, reponame, branch, odoo_path)
simulate_install_pypi(cmd)
